page.title: 17CLIMATE AND VEGETATION
page.content:
The climate is classed as {maritime} due to the prevailing westerly winds from the Atlantic Ocean.The winters are generally mild.February is the coldest month with an average temperature of 40 degrees F and August the warmest month with an average of 60 degrees F.The rainfall is heavy with about 725mm per year,most of which falls in late autumn and winter.
The natural vegetation is deciduous with examples of oak,beech and elm.On the higher ground the trees are stunted due to the high winds.On the mountain tops, the trees are replaced by poor grasses,ferns and heathers.
Soils are poor due to heavy rainfall and are wet,cold and infertile.
